transcripts.text: The next one I would like to raise is the ad hominem fallacy.  This is where someone attacks the person who is making the argument as opposed to the argument itself.  Ad hominem fallacies try to disprove an argument by focusing on the character of the person.  I think God's existence is necessary based on the concept of a perfect being.  No, you're wrong.  You're just a Bible-bashing Christian who cannot fit into a modern world.  Insulting a person's character does not mean their arguments are invalid and we should only focus on the arguments raised rather than who is saying them.
